title: Not worth it
text: After just visiting similar malls in Italy and LA, we concluded that the selection of designer items is very limited, some 3 season old, and the prices are almost double than other outlet malls. I found better selection and prices in the center of Vienna. It is a good choice if you go for more mid-range labels, especially sports labels, but for A list designer is a total waste of time. Also, try to rent a car, as coming with the bus is the lottery of being able to come back

title: Traditional food
text: The traditional Viennese schnitzel is very good as the other dishes we tried from the menu. The dessert was great. We didn't have reservation and we were lucky to find a table. The staff is fast, useful and attentive. The only downside is that the tables are so stuck to one another so you just can't help overhearing other conversations. Maybe it is different with the spring-summer terrace.

title: Almost royal - like
text: After coming to Vienna many times, discovering this spot was probably the best surprise. On our first visit, we went on the second floor, there was a long and slow line, but my friend convinced me it was worth waiting, and she was right. The place is fancy, warm, sophisticated. The choice of sweet delights and drinks is really fine. Unfortunately, the top floor has limited working hours and they were closing down late afternoon. Next time we came back, we opt for the first floor, luckily there were no waiting lines as it was during the work hours. The first floor was even better. I found my favourite drink, the Gerstner special Baronini drink. Filled up the present basket on the ground floor with dessert boxes and mini bottles of wine. Just love this place

title: Can't get more traditional then this
text: We went on the recommendation from friends who live in Vienna, after a long day of traveling and sightseeing. We ere lucky there was no waiting line and we didn´t need a reservation. The service was nice and the food arrived fast. We truly enjoyed the traditional Austrian plates. The schnitzels were so big, as my daughter joked as a "car wheel". The menu is limited to a few specialties of the restaurant but all the other food options we tried were delicious. Definitely a recommendation

title: Brilliant combination between museum and palace
text:
Albertina is without a doubt one of the greatest art museums. It has a huge collection of works, especially from French impressionism including Monet, Picasso, Chagall.
The palace staterooms are worth a visit in their own right. They used to be the largest Habsburg residential palace were once lived in by the favourite daughter of Empress Maria Theresia, Archduchess Marie-Christine. The vibrant colors of the palace kept some of the original furniture. It is a true history journey, with spectacular esthetic, wealth and history. Every single room in the museum and the palace deserves a visit. Remarkable top to bottom mirrors combined with world art are just breathtaking. Put Albertin on your must-see list, you will not regret it

title: One of the most beautiful cities in the world
text: Vienna is one of the most beautiful, historically rich and overwhelmingly vibrant cities in the world, certainly in Europe. There are so many things to be seen in all aspects, history, art, architecture, but do take time to walk around instead of using the public transport (although it is very well organized, safe, clean and punctual) all the time. The city is so vibrant, colorful and fresh, it is shame not to feel its street vibes.

title: Great location
text: The hotel location is really good, you are on the walking distance from the few important spots in the city, like the Opera house, St. Stephen's Cathedral or Belvedere museum on the other side. The room was special and with a nice view. The breakfast was truly superb, excellent choice and stunning view from the restaurant. On the downside, was the service. The reception staff and concierge were not helpful at all during our attempt to get to Parndorf shopping, all they wanted to achieve was to get their partner company to drive us back and forth for absurd amount, without even trying to find another solution. Also, it was quite annoying that the mini bar in the room was locked, which was first time experience for us in a five-star hotel. We asked the front desk to unlock it, but they didn´t. After we left the money guarantee and asked for the second time they opened it. Besides these setbacks, the hotel is nice and comfortable, the pool and the spa are a real pleasure.

title: The best hidden gem in the city
text: Amazing place, such a wonderful tribute to art, culture, sports. It is a true leisure spot for visitors. It is open to everyone, no reservations. The architecture is magnificent, the whole concept is remarkable. We spent the New Year's Eve there, and could not find any flaw. The library is just extraordinary, the parks, the green rooftop, the sledge park. There are permanent and temporary galleries, the National Opera Theater and the National Library are all part of it. The restaurants and the coffee spots are great with very good service. The best surprise in Athens, don't miss it

title: Worth a visit
text: Do not miss to witness the part of the history, in many details and packed with facts. If you are true art and history lover, do hire a guide, otherwise, the museum info would be quite enough. It is not very big, but there are several interesting corners. Worth a visit.
place: Skip the Line: Athens New Acropolis Museum Ticket

title: Great stroll
text: A very pleasant pedestrian area that leads from the acropolis to the city center. It's full of small shops and traditional restaurants. Well spent time, surrounded with local amenities

title: Amazing as always
text: The amazing witness of human civilization, history and the art of construction and worshiping. No matter how many times you visit it, it's always special and worthwhile. It is helpful to hire a guide as there are so many interesting facts and stories. A bonus is the gorgeous view of 360 degrees, of Athens. Truly breathtaking.

title: We didn't get the room we asked and paid for
text: For me, being a person who does not live on the seaside coast, is very important to have the sea view whenever I stay somewhere near the sea/ocean. When we choose this hotel, one of the pluses we counted on was the view. When we got there on a snowy and cold night after a prolonged journey, I was hoping for the room we asked and paid for. Upon check-in, I mentioned to the receptionist that we asked for the sea view room, and he convinced me that we have one with and the other without a balcony and sea view (we had a connected room for the children). Of course, we didn't get a sea view room, we got the street view, with a tiny glimpse of a boat somewhere further, above the rooftops. No sea view. As it was the night before New Year's Eve, we decided we are not going to destroy the holiday spirit of the family by fighting with the hotel staff. However, I just want to point out that the photos you see on the booking are not from the rooms they sell as sea view. Other amenities were decent, private parking at all times, a la card breakfast was really good, as there were not many other guests, polite reception staff and clean rooms.

title: Just about everything at one place
text: Just about everything that shopping/walking/entertaining district should have. There are hundreds of stores, malls, restaurants and coffee places. It is a vibrant, colorful, pedestrian area, safe for hours of strolling and offering quality time. At nights it is even more lively with the street entertainers.

title: Good food, strange atmosphere
text: The menu was a little bit limited, the food was average, and the service was good. Unfortunately, the whole atmosphere was a bit off, like something was missing.

title: Don't get high expectations
text: Do not get your hopes and expectations too high, as the place is probably not what you might expect. For a first time visitor, it is definitely one of the main visiting spots, but besides souvenir shops that all look alike and few cafes, there is not much else. The place is packed with people all the time, so be aware of pickpocketers. The museums around can be fun, but that is another story.

title: Just great
text: Excellent food with great selection and options, amazing cocktails, superb atmosphere. The service is very good, and place is truly superb. Highest recommendation

title: Descent
text: The position of the restaurant is fantastic, it wasn't on our list of planned stops, but we were hungry and happy that we didn't need a reservation. The food though was average, as no one in the kitchen was really trying too much, it was a bit overpriced and we had to ask several times for tap water. Otherwise, the service was nice and we were lucky to get a table with a view. Overall quite a lovely experience.

title: Must visit L.A place
text: If not for the story behind it, or their image, this place deserves a visit for the truly tasty food. Most of the time, the waiting lines are very long, you might need to plan an additional 30 - 45 minutes of waiting. But, if you get there in the early afternoon, you might end up with a great table and the ocean view. Do not expect a fancy atmosphere, this is a laid back colorful place. Completely in accordance to the story.

title: Short and fun
text: It wasn't on our list, but using the hop-on-hop-off bus, we got the free entrance with the bus tickets. It is a bit complicated that the tours a time-dependent so you can't get inside when it is suitable for you, but you got to wait for a certain period that they will share when you get there. However, the tour itself was interesting, history, stars, old-time Holywood glamour, lots of fun facts, unfortunately, we could not hear well what the guide was saying as the sound from the movie projection was extremely loud. It is a short tour, but it wasn't a waste of time. If you happen to be there, I would recommend the visit

title: You can find good ice cream and better service somewhere else
text: The ice cream is really good, typical Italian gelato, but the service was terrible. The guys working there were not patient while we were agreeing on the orders of our friend's group, making sounds and rolling eyes, while there was no one else inside but us. The ice cream itself was overpriced and when we wanted to sit outside, the tables were so dirty, there was trash everywhere around them, the chairs were stained with ice cream, that we really just gave up and left.

title: So. Much. Fun
text: There was so much fun stuff, great photo opportunities and chances to step into the celebrities' world. There were no long lines, the tickets are not overly costly, and you can get around at your own pace as the place is not packed with people. We enjoyed it and would recommend it as an activity for friends and family

title: The jewel
text: It wasn't on our "must visit" list, actually, we got there without knowing what it is, while visiting nearby Staples Center and the Grammy Museum. It looked very nice and we loved the fact that was open without reservation. The service was spot on, but the food was OMG. Not over the top fancy, but sooo tasty. The size of those portions was out of this world. Especially the chocolate cake. It took three of us to share that ONE piece, and I'm quite sure the fourth person would have been useful too. It is for sure a must-stop spot, you will not regret it

title: Overrated
text: It is worth a one time visit only. If your days and time are limited you can surely skip this one without feeling guilty that you are missing anything. It's nice, but that is about it. Not much to do, besides taking a few photos (probably all look the same) and read short info. Certainly don't even bother during the day, if you decide to give it a chance at least do it at night.

title: Amazing sunsets are giving it a better rating than it deserves
text: Lively and vibrant place, many things to do, the skate park is fabulous, there are so many great bars and restaurants, coffee places, but also lots of trashy souvenir shops and many homeless people. In the afternoons and weekends, it is packed with people. But, you can get a nice stroll on the working days. It is not very safe from pickpocketers, so be aware of your belongings. Otherwise, an amazing sunset spot.

title: Remarkable artistic experience
text: I'm not into contemporary art myself, but Broad is next level artistic, warm, true cultural center. I liked the Pop art of the 1960s and the collections and works by Roy Lichtenstein, Ed Ruscha, and Andy Warhol, but truly enjoyed the 1980s especially Keith Haring works. The highlight of the visit to me was the infinity mirrored room. Although the time inside was limited at 45 seconds, you got the feeling of being alone with millions of stars, quite exquisite. I would recommend it to every true art lover. Make your visit flawless by making sure you have a time reservation before you get there, both for the main entrance but also for the infinity mirrored room

title: Breakfast with your feet in the sand and great view
text: We were pleasantly surprised that we didn't need a reservation and we still got the table in the sand with an amazing sea view. The food was delicious, the service was fast and spotless and we enjoyed every minute in the November sun. The atmosphere was so laid back, very relaxed despite the fact that you could see some A-listers and people from the movie industry having Sunday breakfast here. There is parking nearby, and you are free to take a walk on this most famous beach in Malibu. Would definitely recommend

title: One of the most amazing spots in LA
text: The atmosphere at the rooftop, was so great, that I'm willing to forget the self-service drinks politics. The sunset was so gorgeous in a late afternoon in fall, that for a few moments everyone went quiet, despite the fact that the bar was packed with people. The chill music was great, the band playing was "walking" the thin line of relaxation but a cheerful bit. I would definitely recommend it, for dinner or drinks, but make sure it's the sunset period. You will never forget it.

title: Expected much more
text: As true music lovers, we were a bit disappointed with the quantity of information and the number of music stars included and available for visitors. There were so many amazing achievements and so many great musicians in history, it is shame that you could not see at least a small tribute for many of them. However, those that are included have a nice tribute and you might find some really interesting facts. It is a small museum, it will not provide entertainment for more than 60 -90 minutes. Not even close to how big Grammy's were in our eyes. The outside of the museum is interesting as well, so do walk around the building

title: Great Insta scenery, but not much to do
text: While the place is colorful and looks vibrant, there is not much (if anything) to see or do here. We got here before noon and the place was barely awakened. There are not many coffee shops or places to hand out and just chill. You can only go up and down the pier, eventually, hang out with the sunbathing seals, It was the only moving part of our visit. Although it is a good scenery for photos. While there, you can take a walk to Marina Bay, it is not too far and it's a pleasant walk

title: A true jewel of art and culture
text: No matter how many times you go there, or how many world-famous museums you see, Getty is truly a next level od combining art, design, world culture, and civilization. And a bit more, those amazing gardens and breathtaking views. It is a definitive must, no matter if you are local or a tourist. It is the place that uplifts personal knowledge, art excitement and entertainment.

title: A true gateway to the cosmos
text:
For all the science and space lovers this is the place to be. So many different aspects and so many things to see, hear and touch. It's a unique experience, the telescope is amazing and the level of education is useful for every age.
The Observatory holds public viewing events for most lunar and solar eclipses. There are different shows that are perfectly done, I would suggest Centered in the Universe. Be aware that you need to be there at least an hour and a half to buy tickets for the show, as there are lines. The entrance to the observatory is free of charge. Don't get over-excited about that Holywood sigh, as it is quite far though, bt the view down to L.A is just remarkable. The observatory can easily become one of the best spots of one's trip

title: A movie spot - do take a walk
text: We got there around 10 am and it was quite a delightful stroll, as the streets were not crowded, the stores were open, it was a pleasant sunny day and it was really enjoyable. It is a true movie spot and the original tourist stop, so it is a must-visit, at least once.

title: The sweet corner
text: Lovely place, great vibes. Love the seats next to the window, gives you the in and out atmosphere. I loved the vegan chip cookie and the matcha tea

title: Amazing sunset spot
text: The Santa Monica Pier is a shiny spot to visit, but it's a one-timer really. It is fun, and loud, and crowded, there is food, and magnets, and souvenirs, but it is so full that finding a free table is almost impossible, especially during the weekends. However, the sunsets are spectacular, I don't think I've seen anything quite like it. It makes the whole hustle with the crowd worthwhile, once you get that perfect sunset spot.

title: Quality consistency of first class
text: When we entered the first time, it was not a place on our list, we were just tired and hungry. This place made us come back to life. The atmosphere is so great, the service is excellent and the food is just amazing. As we were staying in the nearby hotel, we came back to Ivy several times, and every time, both the food quality and the service were as good as the first time. It deserves the highest score for consistency and perfection. Do not miss it

title: One of the greatest spots in Santa Monica
text: It was such a delightful stay that we truly enjoyed every minute of it. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to the king suite, and it was really fantastic. I just loved the art deco style in and out, wide bedroom, oceanside view, amazing large living room, the walk-in closet. It was absolutely fabulous. The room maintenance was spotless, always with little sweet daily presents. The food in the restaurant was great, the menu was limited but the quality of the food was beyond great, the breakfast options were especially good. The hotel is on a walking distance from the very popular Third Street Promenade as well as the Santa Monica pier. The restaurant balcony is facing the ocean and is one of the spots that allow you to enjoy the most beautiful sunsets in the world. I can recommend it full-heartedly

title: Worth while visit
text: Although there is some restoration going on, and certain areas were closed for visitors, this is a truly remarkable spot with a significant history. If you come alone you might struggle with a lack of information, so I would suggest you hire a professional tour guide. The castle is quite big, but walking around is very pleasant and not very physically demanding. There are some amazing spots with the sea view, that you would most certainly enjoy

title: The most spectacular spot in Bodrum
text:
This is a place to ease your nerves, to calm your heart and to enjoy the most spectacular view on this side of the Turkish coast. Everything in this hotel, from the breakfast atmosphere till the sunset colors and bedtime chill out music is like walking on the clouds.
Absolutely recommended

title: Disappointing
text: It was our third time to stay in this hotel and we were really looking forward to our next visit to Frankfurt. Unfortunately, we had some problems with the flight that was late due to technical problems, so we arrived at the hotel at 3 in the morning, exhausted and eager to get to our room. Imagine our surprise when the man at the reception told us that, because we were late, there are no rooms available. Shocked, I showed him our invoice with a pre-paid for all of our stay (3 nights). He panicked for a moment, but then told us that we were actually lucky as there was just one room available. Of course, the room did not fulfill any of our demands mentioned in the booking ( separate beds, street view...). We got a joint bed, a view between two walls, as we got the room for disabled persons as everything in it was made suitable for their needs, which was problematic for us, as we are tall people and could not use the bathroom amenities. Nevertheless, as we were in Frankfurt for a joyful event, we decided that we will enjoy our stay as much as we can. For the following morning, we got to the breakfast area a few minutes before closing down. as soon as we got to the restaurant, we cross the path with a mouse. Yes, a real, live rat. My daughter ( as well as few other ladies sitting) screamed, as I ran to the waitress and told her they have a rat around the food area, to which she waved her hand and told me: yeah, yeah, we know. For the rest of our stay, we only had coffee in the restaurant. So, this is not the same hotel that I remembered from few years back. At this point, I'm sorry for the huge amount we paid thinking we are heading to a five-star hotel when all we got was a below-average experience and no explanation or apology for the mistreatment. So, do avoid, although the location is very good, there are plenty of other opinions nearby.

title: Perfect place to get lost in
text: Probably one of the best places in the world to get lost in. It is a must-visit spot, not only for the shopping lovers but for everyone that recognizes the cultural significance in this place in the life of every Parisien. From the high-end designer shops to the pampering cosmetics, and great coffee places for bit of french charm with some macaroons and drinks. Do visit.

title: Great potential to be the best in the area
text:
We were pleasantly surprised by how lovely the hotel is, having to book it only a few days prior to our arrival. We stayed in the newer part of the resort, and the rooms were spacious and clean.
Good sides: Great garden area, good rooms with a functional kitchen (although our fridge was opening towards the wall), nice beach, the staff especially at the beach bar very nice. The toiletries are awesome. There is plenty of parking spots and they have extra hotel security at the gate.
Downside: The resort is big, but is lacking good entertainment activities. We were traveling with teen kids and literally there is nothing to do in the evening if you decide to stay in the hotel. The lobby needs some atmosphere to feel a bit more lively, the rooms need some character details to give them individuality. The food in the restaurant was of good quality, but the choices were poor. If you stay more then 4 days, you can go to breakfast with eyes closed. We asked to pay extra in order to get the room with a sea view, but we were told it's not possible because we didn't book directly with them, but with a travel agency. So the reception needs to be more flexible.
However, this is a nice hotel, with good possibilities for improvements in order to shine bright in the area of Halkidiki.

title: Our most favorable summer hotel in Turkey
text: Honestly, it was much better than the last time we stayed here. This is a hotel that is loved by every member of our family, great for all generations. We asked for a good view, and got the sixth-floor corner room on the west side, which we loved because we could watch the sea and the beautiful beach, but also enjoying the sunsets every single day. They made some changes from last year, adding new fun stations, some activities, and they even fixed the wifi, that the signal was strong on the beach as it was oin the lobby. The beach was fabulous, no fight over the sunbeds, there is always a free spot in the first rows (unless you go there at noon), enough tables, beds, towels. The staff can not be friendlier, always smiling an chatty. My husband and I were spending realy nice time at the chillout bar which is 16+, so no noise, always clean sitting sets, great cocktails. During our stay, they even change the whole design completely, from white to blue, all clean and perfectly stylish. Our girls were being preoccupied with many activities in their clubs, the junior for up to 13 years and the teen clubs for 13+. They kept them busy and enjoying the activities and new friendships, so many things for everyone. Special thanks to Mr. Andrew, the leader of the teens club, for taking such good care of our daughter the second year in a row. We loved the a la card restaurants, especially the Fish one. You get served with the perfect food, amazing location, and the best sunset. Adorable. Our room was spotless and our housekeeping lady had a great sense of humor that she showed over the towel animals she left on our bed. We loved them. All in all, the highest recommendation for Tui, we can't wait to come back.

title: Impressed by details
text: We were impressed by the attention paid on every single detail in this hotel. The decoration of the rooms, everything is stylish and new, modern and of good quality, beddings and the room details, the toiletries, the towels, the welcome package in the lobby, the restaurant, the way of serving the food, the pool bar, everything is perfect to the core. The management knows their job very well. On the plus side, it is an adults-only hotel, which is something new to me in Turkey, but the concept is very well worked upon. On the downside is the distance from the beach, there is about 10 minutes of a walk, which is not far unless is 40 degrees. This means no sea view, but there is a very good pool view. This is a very enjoyable hotel and I loved every minute of our stay. As guests, we were very well taken care of. Only the highest recommendation for Raga.

title: No wow effect here
text: Aside from the tunnel that is spectacular by itself and is fun to walk through, (if you are lucky not to go with dozens of other visitors) the rest of it was a bit disappointing. The exhibitions were poor, not very informational, so people don't stay longer than a few seconds. The ticket price is quite high, so not sure if it's worth a half-day of your vacation.
place: Skip the Line: Antalya Aquarium Ticket with Optional Transfer

title: Good potential to become awesome
text: One of the most family-friendly hotels we have ever been to. The room was lovely, and the view was very good. The pools were great, the food choices limitless, the restaurant atmosphere was very good having, no crowds, or fights over food. There are so many things to do, especially aiming towards young kids. The beach was phenomenal and the lobby bar staff, as well as other bars personal, deserve 5 star for their efforts and good service. We had a great time in the entertaining area, although it was tiny and it was very hot inside. I'll take away a star from the review because of the entertainment team. We were staying as a group of friends, and the entertainment team was quite persistent in taking us to the disco area, which was fine. Unless the moment we got there, they would concentrate on the russion guests and their choice of music. Also, the bar service at the club was slow and selective over which guests get to be served first. Kind of spoiled the overall feeling.
place: Ic Hotels Green Palace kids Concept

title: Time well spent
text: A fantastic combination to feel and learn a bit of history and enjoy the amazing photo opportunity. In between the sea and the harbor, the walk towards it is a pure pleasure. Do not mind the shops on the way as they are overpriced and money-oriented. Just enjoy the scenery and these amazing accomplishments of human civilization. It is even more fascinating at night

title: Well worth a visit
text: You can't be wrong with a visit to the Land of legends. The place is mesmerizing, just great for everybody, small kids, big kids, friends, couples, there are so many things to do. If you are an adrenaline junkie, you can get your head spinning on the rollercoaster, rockets and other activities for brave people. The lazy river was fantastic, the wave pool, the plane flight. There is a great choice of restaurants, places for ice creams and desserts, also there is a Starbucks nearby (but not in the complex of the activities). Even if not everybody from your company like adrenaline activities, there are plenty of other things to do. The shopping street at the entrance of the park is one of them. In any case, it is well worth a visit and a day of your vacation time
place: The Land of Legends Theme Park

title: Heaven
text: Just magnificent. Do not miss this fantastic place with a wonderful beach, warm service, and a fantastic atmosphere. If you are an early bird, and you get there among the first guests you get the impression like you are on another planet. It's clean, quiet, with astonishing natural beauty.

title: great location, fantastic view
text: We only stopped here for a drink, as we didn't have time to try the food. Cocktails were amazing, the bar is new and clean (plus they totally paid attention to the look and the maintenance of the toilet, which is not a case in many similar bar/restaurants in the area). The service was good and the location and the view just magnificent

title: Great choice for families
text: It is a great example of classical Turkish hospitality, very nice rooms, clean amenities, great entertainment. The beach is a sandy and clean, very good organization, there is a plant of food choices, although sometimes the atmosphere in the restaurants can be frantic. I wish they would have more rooms or facilities with direct view to the sea, I kind of missed to opportunity to watch the sunrises and sunsets unless you are not on the beach. We were a group of friends and at nights, while being in the lobby they would ask us to be quiet because of the rooms just above it, which was not very practical. However, I do recommend this place for families with young children, not so for couples or friends group.

title: Crowded and tourist oriented
text: It is a remarkable little village with a significant place in history. Unfortunately, many, many steps can make the visit quite tiring to the elderly people and families with young children. However, the view from up there is just magnificent. Scrolling down the narrow streets, it is like a step into the past. But, being as one of the most popular places in Paris, it is expected to be blocked with tourists. The quality of food, drinks, and service itself in the many restaurants is to say at least, debatable. Also, as the place is crowded with people, be aware of pickpocketers.

title: French all the way
text: One of the coziest places in the area, charming, small, delicious food, warm service. French all the way. The bonus is the view of the Seine river and the Notre Dame Cathedral. the neighborhood is lively and full of people, with lots of coffee bars but still, you can't miss this lovely place. Try the cream brulee, it's amazing

title: Not worth it
text: The service was terrible. We were sited in the middle of the restaurant on a tiny table, that barely fit our drinks and glasses, not to mention the food. There was no place to put our shopping bags, nor our personal bags. Extremely inconvenient and not pleasurable at all. Waited for 10 minutes to get the second drink, and another 15 to get the ketchup. And another 10 to get the bill. The food was average, and the prices skyrocketed. We couldn't wait to leave the place. The location is the only plus, but there are so many nicer places in the area, so spend your money wisely

title: The top photo spot
text: A much better place to take that famous Eiffel tower photos, then to the tower itself. The square is just fantastic, you can relax, or go to the near by restaurants, visit the museums or enter boat for Seine cruise near by. Mornings are absolutely great, less people too. We were there before noon, on a cloudy day and the pictures were still incredible

title: Always crowded
text: If it is your first time, for sure, anyone must go up. Otherwise it is the same overrated, overcrowded, touristic spot in which you will get stuck for hours in line, you will be squeezed in the elevators and pushed around on the top by the hundreds of visitors. Do not expect a sophisticated experience, it is nice to feel it, once. But basically, the surrounding, the gardens, and the view to the tower from other areas in the city are much more pleasurable.

title: Amazing as always
text:
No matter how many times you go to Paris, or how many times you go to Louvre, there is always something new, or something you missed the previous times, or something you didn't have time to dedicate with certain exhibitions. Louvre can never disappoint. The last time I visited, had this absolutely fantastic opportunity to stand in front of Mona Lisa, alone. Alone. No crowds, no pushing, no photo ops. After so many times visiting this monument for human civilization, there are few things I learned:
- get your electronic ticket, you still get in line, but the waiting is way shorter then with regular
- prepare your self for some waiting( for entrance, for tickets if you don't have one, for audio guides, for coffees) It is a huge place, with thousands of people visiting it every day
- Start from the top and move to the ground level, it is easier to navigate through so many exhibition points
- Put on a comfortable shoes and clothes, it is a looong walk through art
- do not get disappointed if you don't get to enter everywhere or see everything. It is a great chance for the next time round
And yes, we all like to enjoy Paris in spring and summer, but do bare on mind, so does people from around the world.

title: In the heart of just about everything
text: What a great choice we made, by staying in the heart of Paris. It is an truly excellent hotel, on a walking distance from some of the most spectacular sites in Paris, such as the Notre Dame and the Louvre. There are plenty of restaurants and bars in the neighborhood, so you truly don't have to worry about staying hungry or feeling lonely. This is a cheerful part of the city and it is quite safe to move around. Hotel itself is very clean, well organised, with a lovely breakfast, and most of all a fabulous roof top terrace with the view of Paris and the Eiffel tower. Would definitely recommend a stay.

title: Great escape room
text: It was a lovely winter experience. The hotel is new and modern, although the rooms still have the feeling of a bit of rustic, mountain style. The quality of the food and the restaurant was excellent. The spa center and the pool is also good entertainment, but there is a need to pay more attention on the level of maintaining the cleanness of the pool, especially after the busy hours. As we were there on a business conference, the conference rooms we were using, were not the most spectacular, as sometimes we were in lack of fresh air. However we did enjoy the escape room, it was probably the highlight of our stay.

title: Great walk
text: No rush, a great walk, amazing views on the both sides of the city. Great photo opt, interesting history and architecture. Lovely experience

title: Fascinating mixture of history, architecture, spirit
text: Do not rush, once you decide to visit this place. There are so many great spots, the church, the towers, the Fisherman's bastion. So many history, such a great stories, amazing architecture. The whole area around it, has the special feeling, so do take you time and walk around it. The little shops are fabulous, but unfortunately the best spots for photo ops are inside the restaurants so you need to pay the entrance. Also, since this is one of the most popular places in the city, it is heavily crowded and it is better to put it either firs or last on your daily agenda.

title: Great fun
text: It is a great fun. The view is amazing, especially at night when the city look all golden. The only thing to watch for, is the breeze in the cabins, mostly during winter months when it can get truly freezing. So do have some extra scarfs or cap, although there are certain blankets inside

title: Great view
text: One of the best places in the city. The view is amazing and there are so many beautiful spots to enjoy. It would have been nice if there were certain restaurants or coffee places during the winter months, to enjoy a warm drink.

title: Great photo ops
text: The walks on the banks from each side are quite a nice experience, especially during the sunset hours. There are dedicated areas to walk and cycle, it is not crowdes and it is quite enjoyable

title: Fun for youngsters
text: It is a very good hotel, especially if you are traveling with small kids. There is pure enjoyment for them, and so many activities in the pools. However if you travel as a couple or with teenagers, it might be a bit boring. There are no evening activities, basically nothing to entertain with after the dinner hours. Regarding the rooms, there are specious and clean, with nice view of the surrounding nature. Breakfast is good, with great choices of food, but it is always so crowded in the restaurant, which completely kills any feeling of peace and calmness. As this is a big hotel, and there are many families with small children, everywhere is crowded and loud. The city center is quite far from the hotel, but there is an option to use the bus that has a route only from/to the hotel. Bare on mind that the schedule is flexible, and twice we were left in the city and had to take a taxi, as the bus didn't show. However, it is a fun hotel to stay in, but I believe once is enough.

title: Choices, choices
text: The most difficult decisions are connected to this place. Such a great variety of sweets, breads, cookies, it is impossible to count calories. Coffee, however is a different topic, not very good quality, so do opt for tea and don't spoil the sweet mood

title: The place where diet dies
text: Forget about your diet, this place is pure hedonism. Enjoy it, you can always go back in counting calories.

title: A must see
text: There are so many things to hear, see, learn about and to become aware of how far the humanity has come. All those great minds deserve the praise given to them. It is a bit of a frustration though to wait for the scheduled guided tours, a there are so many other people on them, and you can not hear just about everything. a bit of a modern and technologically innovative approach will bring more satisfaction to the science lovers. Do visit the museum store, there are so many interesting things to buy and give. Also have the Nobel ice cream in the cafeteria, while enjoying the view on the square.

title: Unpretentious royal house
text: It is a interesting tour around the different palaces, but do bare on mind that this is not even close to the luxury, decadence, style or richness like the French or Spanish, or even Austrian royal castles. It is simple and sophisticated, full of history but completely unpretentious. Do come during the guards shift, if you can, it is really special and cheerful.
place: The Royal Palace in Stockholm Admission Ticket

title: Step into the past
text: Very charming and colorful area, beautiful architecture. It is a feel good step into the past. The square is surrounded with small restaurant, bars, the Nobel museum is in the area, very lovely walk.

title: enjoyable trip
text: it was romantic, colorful, picturesque, informative end enjoyable. if you are lucky to have a nice weather, being on the slow cruise will be a pure pleasure. You really get to know all sides of Stockholm

title: Excellent choice, beautiful room view, great breakfast
text: Absolutely great choice for staying in the center of Stockholm. The hotel is on a walking distance from the train and the bus station with a fast connection to/from the airport as well. It is on a walking or biking distance from Gamla Stan and just about all of the most important tourist sights in the center. We asked for a room with a view, and they do delivered the most astonishing view on the city, the islands, cathedral. We enjoyed coming back each time to the room. The breakfast was one of the richest that we ever tasted, there was not a single thing missing and the hotel coffee was surprisingly good. The rooms are big, clean, modern and comfortable. The care for the guests is immaculate. I would definitely recommend it.

title: Nothing special
text: The food and drinks are not worth mentioning, very poor quality, like they are sick of serving their guests every night. However the dancers and the entertainment crew were fun to watch and the trip itself was pleasant. All in all, if you don't have time for all the attractions in Dubai, you can freely skip this one without feeling guilty.

title: Not worth the trip
text: I kind of imagined it as more of the entertainment center and was quite disappointed to find out that there are not many things to do, besides few spots for photo opportunity and the roller coasters. Unless you a "die for Ferrari fun", I'm not sure if the trip either from Dubai or from Abu Dhabi to the center is worth while. Another turn off are the shops around that have no connection to the theme whatsoever.

title: Extraordinary
text: Astonishing place, with attention paid is the smallest details. It is a holy house, so bare on mind that you need to be dressed accordingly. We were lucky to visit it during the sunset and the colors that were poured into the mosques were magnificent. I would advise to take a professional guide, as there are so many details worth hearing about and the stories that would otherwise be left untold and the whole experience would be damaged.

title: Worth visiting
text: It is a bright and shining as you can see it on many photos (and some movies as well :-)) The architecture made of gold might not fit everybody's sense of style and sophistication, but the place is breathtaking and definitely worth visiting. If you are coming over for few hours only, the lobby bar La cafe signature, is the place to spend them, while tasting the most popular gold capuccino (which is highly over priced and below average in quality)

title: Perfect choice in the heart of Dubai
text: We made absolutely great choice staying at this hotel. It is modern, luxurious, client oriented, with comfortable rooms, great sleeping quality and absolutely amazing room view to the business center of Dubai. The breakfast is rich and delicious, the food and the beverages prepared with paying attention to all the details and using the most quality ingredients. We enjoyed every minute of our stay in the hotel and can highly recommend it

title: Great place to visit, skip the shops
text: The atmosphere is very unique, the architecture is magnificent and it is for sure one of the most memorable places to visit in Dubai. Great photo opportunity, but do skip the crowds in the mornings and early afternoon, as the night hours are more pleasant and the whole experience is more enjoyable. However, the prices in the shops are skyrocketed, the salesmen are not very keen on negotiation and the money driven attitude is present all around including the bars.

title: Iconic hotel
text: If you want to share your dreams with the holder of the Guinness record for the tallest hotel in the world, this is the right place for you. As you may think the rooms are just amazing, comfortable beds, all the necessary amenities in the luxurious and spacious rooms and magnificent view to the city below. Excellent care for their guests, delicious food and lovely pastry shop at the ground floor. It is in the business part of the city with a center location. Absolute worth of staying over.

title: The most spectacular view on the Palm
text:
It is a luxury on a whole new level. The service, the rooms, the view, the quality of the food, everything is just astonishingly beautiful. Being at this great location, in the heart of the new Dubai, and watching the city's pulse and its marina in your hand, it's a truly unique. Having a tea on the roof top terrace, is a completely different experience.
Highly recommended
place: Dukes The Palm, a Royal Hideaway Hotel

title: Great photo opt
text: Try visiting the Dubai Marina after the visit of the souk and you will definitely feel like stepping to another universe. Dubai has a unique ability of uniting the old and the new. The Marina is the very new. It's the 21 century at it's finest
